explanation:
Provide the minimal set of symbols needed to decide whether any controlling expression in OS_SocketOpen_Impl is an invariant (constant at compile time) or could vary at run time.

- OS_stream_internal_record_t: needed to see the type and declaration of the stream structure and in particular the types of members socket_type and socket_domain (to determine if they are compile-time constants, enums, bitfields, or volatile/runtime-updated fields).

- OS_impl_file_internal_record_t: needed to see the type of impl and the fd member (to confirm impl->fd is runtime-assigned and the if (impl->fd < 0) controlling expression is not an invariant).

- OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET: macro/function used to fetch impl and stream from token; its expansion/behavior is required to know whether stream->socket_type/socket_domain are computed or replaced by compile-time constants.

- OS_IMPL_SET_SOCKET_FLAGS: macro invoked at the end of the function; its expansion could contain additional control statements whose controlling expressions must be checked for invariance.

- OS_SetSocketDefaultFlags_Impl: the implementation called (or referenced) by OS_IMPL_SET_SOCKET_FLAGS; include its definition because it may contain control expressions that must be analyzed under MISRA rule.

- OS_ObjectIndexFromToken: appears in the static call graph and may be used by OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET or OS_IMPL_SET_SOCKET_FLAGS; its behavior could affect whether object lookup yields a compile-time constant index or a runtime value.

- OS_object_token_t: type of the token parameter; need the definition to know whether dereferencing *token yields a compile-time constant or a runtime-varying identifier.

- OS_SocketType_DATAGRAM and OS_SocketType_STREAM: definitions of the switch case values used in switch(stream->socket_type) are required to know whether these are ordinary runtime enum values or macro/constant expressions that would make the controlling expression invariant.

- OS_SocketDomain_INET and OS_SocketDomain_INET6: definitions used in switch(stream->socket_domain); required for same reason as socket type constants.

- OS_NETWORK_SUPPORTS_IPV6: conditional compile macro that changes available cases; needed to know which code paths are compiled in and whether any controlling expression becomes a compile-time constant because of conditional compilation.

Together these symbols let an analyst determine whether the switch/if controlling expressions in OS_SocketOpen_Impl are invariant constant expressions (and thus potentially violate MISRA) or are runtime-dependent and therefore acceptable.
